src.assignment1.addressbook

Class AddressBook

  • java.lang.Object
    • src.assignment1.addressbook.AddressBook

  • public class AddressBook
extends java.lang.Object
    The AddressBook class is meant to store information of users in the form of name, email address, phone number and notes. This class provides with APIs to add, remove and search for a contact. There are API to store and retrieve a address book from a file.
    Author:
    Anurag

    • Constructor Detail

      • AddressBook

        public AddressBook()

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public boolean add(Contact contact)
        Function to add a new contact to the address book.
        Parameters:
        contact - Contact to be added.
        Returns:
        Boolean value based on success of operation.

      • remove

        public boolean remove(Contact contact)
        Function to remove a contact from address book. Finds a contact that matches all the field of the contact to be deleted and removes its first occurrence from the address book.
        Parameters:
        contact - Contact to be removed.
        Returns:
        Boolean value based on success of operation.

      • search

        public java.util.ArrayList<Contact> search(java.lang.String searchText)
        Function to get a list of all contacts that matches a given search text. The function looks for the given text in all the fields of contact. It is not case sensitive search.
        Parameters:
        searchText - The text that needs to be matched to.
        Returns:
        List of contacts that matched searchText.

      • importContact

        public boolean importContact(java.lang.String path)
        Function to import contacts from a .json file.
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the file that contains address book information.
        Returns:
        Boolean value indicating success of import of contact.

      • exportContacts

        public boolean exportContacts(java.lang.String path)
        Function used to write contact information to a file.
        Parameters:
        path - This parameter specifies the path to file where entries should be written. The file should be in .json format.
        Returns:
        Boolean value indicating if export was successful.
